meanings.definition: To revoke or annul (a law or act)
meanings.sent1: The government is repealing the outdated law.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted on repealing the parking regulation.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked about repealing the law of gravity.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like repealing barriers in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to be repealing the darkness around the house.

meanings.definition: To withdraw or rescind (a decision or policy)
meanings.sent1: The company is repealing its no-work-from-home policy.
meanings.sent2: The principal announced repealing the new dress code.
meanings.sent3: The kids cheered at the idea of repealing homework forever.
meanings.sent4: His apology felt like repealing the hurtful words he said.
meanings.sent5: The rain was repealing the drought-stricken fields with life.
